Fahad Hussain

Pakistan · +92 316-5209935 · fahadh.3@yahoo.com

I work in materials science and energy research with a focus on electrochemical energy storage devices, particularly supercapacitors. My work bridges physics, chemistry, and real-world engineering applications. I believe in practical problem-solving, clean design, and collaborative learning.

Experience

Lecturer of Physics

Khadija-tul-Kubra School and Colleges

Taught Physics to Grades 9–12 with a strong record of student performance (up to 96%). Developed simplified methods for complex topics and integrated real-life applications into classroom learning. Also served as Chief Proctor and managed the Science Laboratory.

2023 – Present

Research Intern

Renewable Energy Research Lab, GIK Institute

Worked on Pr6O11/HKUST-1 hybrid nanocomposites for supercapacitor electrodes. Conducted electrochemical evaluations, co-authored a manuscript, and presented research at a national conference.

2023

Education

Government Postgraduate College, Mansehra

Bachelor of Science in Physics

Graduated with distinction. Strong academic background in solid-state physics and energy applications.

2020 – 2024

Skills

Technical Tools & Areas
  • Electrochemical Energy Storage
  • Materials Characterization
  • Python (basic automation & data handling)

  • Scientific Writing & Teaching

Interests

I enjoy exploring emerging topics in renewable energy, solid-state physics, and nanomaterials. Outside academics, I lead the Roots of Hope tree plantation project and have a strong interest in community development and environmental education.

Volunteering

Roots of Hope – Founder & Coordinator
Organized tree plantation drives across Punjab and KPK. Managed volunteer teams, coordinated logistics, and worked closely with orphanages and environmental partners. Successfully led the Rawalpindi chapter with over 130 trees planted and ensured community-driven post-care.
